register.description: This register contains the IP revision code

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads return 0
IP revision

register.description: This register allows to control various parameters of the OCP interface.

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads returns 0
Master interface power management, standby/wait control

bitenum.description: Force-standby.MStandby is only asserted when the module is disabled. MStandby is only asserted when the module is disabled.
No-Standby:MStandby is never asserted
Smart-Standby.MStandby is asserted based on the internal activity of the module

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads returns 0
Clocks activity during wake up mode period

bitenum.description: OCP and Functional clocks can be switched off
Functional clocks can be switched off and OCP clocks are mantained during wake up period
OCP and Functional clocks are maintained during wake up period
OCP clocks can be switched off and Functional clocks are maintained during wake up period

bitfield.description: Write 0's for future compatibility. Reads returns 0

Warm reset. Set this bit to 1 triggers a module warm reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During reads, it always returns 0. The warm reset keep the configuration registers unchanged.

bitenum.description: Normal mode
the warmreset is set

bitfield.description: Slave interface power management, Idle req/ack control

bitenum.description: Force-idle.An idle request is acknowledged unconditionally
No-idle. An idle request is never acknowledged
Smart-idle. Acknowledgement to an idle request is given based on the internal activity of the module.

bitfield.description: WakeUp feature control

bitenum.description: Wakeup is disabled
Wakeup is enabled

bitfield.description: Software reset. Set this bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. During reads, it always returns 0.

bitenum.description: Normal mode
The module is reset

bitfield.description: Internal OCP clock gating strategy

bitenum.description: OCP clock is free-running

Automatic OCP L3 and L4 clocks gating strategy is applied, based on the OCP interface activity.. Automatic functional clock gating is also applied to the functional clock based on the module activity (for instance DISPC_ pipe _ATTRIBUTES.ENABLE)

register.description: This register provides status information about the module, excluding the interrupt status information.

bitfield.description: Reset status of DISPC VP1 pixel clock domain

bitenum.description: Internal module reset is on-going
Reset completed

bitfield.description: Reset status of DISPC Functional clock domain

bitenum.description: Internal module reset is on-going
Reset completed

register.description: End Of Interrupt number (for H08 interrupt)

bitfield.description: Software End Of Interrupt (EOI) control. Write number of interrupt output. The IP has 1 interrupt compliant with H08.

bitenum.description: Reads always 0 (no EOI memory)

register.description: Per-end of group (31 down to 0) internal signaling raw interrupt status vector, line #0. Raw status is set even if end of group (31 down to 0) interrupt is not enabled. Write 1 to set the (raw) status, mostly for debug.

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: WB IRQ STATUS register indicates the write-back pipeline interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: VID2 IRQ STATUS register indicates the video pipeline 2 interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: VID1 IRQ STATUS register indicates the video pipeline 1 interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: GFX1 IRQ STATUS register indicates the graphics pipeline 1 interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: VP1 IRQ STATUS register indicates the Video Port 1 interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

register.description: Per-end of group (31 down to 0) internal signaling 'enabled' interrupt status vector, line #0. Enabled status isn't set unless event is enabled. Write 1 to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced (raw status gets cleared, i.e. even if not enabled).

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: WB IRQ STATUS register indicates the write-back pipeline interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: VID2 IRQ STATUS register indicates the video pipeline 2 interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: VID1 IRQ STATUS register indicates the video pipeline 1 interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: GFX1 IRQ STATUS register indicates the graphics pipeline 1 interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

bitfield.description: VP1 IRQ STATUS register indicates the Video Port 1 interrupt events

bitenum.description: No event pending
IRQ event pending

register.description: Per-end of group (31 down to 0) internal event interrupt enable bit vector, line #0. Write 1 to set (enable interrupt). Readout equal to corresponding _CLR register.

bitfield.description: Wake Up Mask

bitenum.description: interrupt disabled
interrupt enabled

bitenum.description: interrupt disabled
interrupt enabled

bitenum.description: interrupt disabled
interrupt enabled

interrupt enabled

interrupt enabled

interrupt enabled

bitfield.description: wakeupen for WB first level interrupt

bitenum.description: Swakeup is not generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode
Swakeup is generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode

bitfield.description: wakeupen for VID2 first level interrupt

bitenum.description: Swakeup is not generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode
Swakeup is generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode

bitfield.description: wakeupen for VID1 first level interrupt

bitenum.description: Swakeup is not generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode
Swakeup is generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode

bitfield.description: wakeupen for GFX1 first level interrupt

bitenum.description: Swakeup is not generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode
Swakeup is generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode

bitfield.description: wakeupen for VP1 first level interrupt

bitenum.description: Swakeup is not generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode
Swakeup is generated when this interrupt is asserted in idle mode

reset value, when the DMA buffer is empty at the beginning of the frame, the MFLAG of each pipe is kept at 0 until PRELOAD is reached, then based on MFLAG_CTRL, MFLAG[1:0] are generated and internal logic is arbitrating between pipeline requests
Even at the beginning of the frame when the DMA buffer is empty, MFLAG_CTRL is used to determine how MFLAG dedicated to each pipe signal shall be driven
MFLAG mechanism is disabled: MFLAG[1:0] out band signals are set to 0
MFLAG mechanism is enabled: MFLAG[1:0] out band signals are always set to 1
MFLAG mechanism is enabled and MFLAG[1:0] out band signals are dynamically set to 0 or 1 depending on the MFLAG rules

register.description: The register configures the DMA buffers allocations to the pipeline.

bitfield.description: Controls if the DMA buffers are re-filled only when the LOW threshold is reached or if all DMA buffers are re-filled when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold. wr: immediate

bitenum.description: Each DMA buffer is re-filled when it reaches LOW threshold.

All DMA buffers are re-filled up to high threshold when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold. (only active DMA buffers shall be considered and when reaching the end of the frame the DMA buffer goes to empty condition so no need to fill it again).

bitfield.description: WB DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines. By default to video 1 pipeline.

bitenum.description: DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo3 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the write-back pipeline.
DMA buffer is not allocated to a pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the video1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx3 pipeline.

bitfield.description: Video2 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines. By default to video 2 pipeline.

bitenum.description: DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo3 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the write-back pipeline.
DMA buffer is not allocated to a pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the video1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx3 pipeline.

bitfield.description: Video1 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines. By default to video 1 pipeline.

bitenum.description: DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo3 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the write-back pipeline.
DMA buffer is not allocated to a pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the video1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx3 pipeline.

bitfield.description: Gfx1 DMA buffer allocation to one of the pipelines. By default to gfx1 pipeline.

bitenum.description: DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo3 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the write-back pipeline.
DMA buffer is not allocated to a pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the video1 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the vdieo2 pipeline.
DMA buffer allocated to the gfx3 pipeline.
